title: New graphical reasoning models for understanding graphical interfaces
proctitle: CHI '91: Proceedings of the SIGCHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems

authors.name: George W. Furnas
authors.institution: Cognitive Science Research, Bellcore, 445 South Street, Morristown, NJ

references.text: Lindsay, Robert K., "Images and inference" Cognition, 29, 1988, 229-250.
Whiteside, J., Jones, S., Levy, P. S., and Wixon, D., User performance with command, menu, and iconic interfaces, Human Factors in Computer Systems, Proceedings of CHI' 85, 1985, 185-191.
Nielsen, J., Traditional dialogue design applied to modem user interfaces, Communications of the ACM, 33(10), 1990, 109-118.
Karat, John Evaluating user interface complexity. Proceedings of the Human Factors Society - 31st Annual Meeting, 1987, 566-570.
Guastello, S. J., Traut, M., and Korienek, G., Verbal versus pictorial representation of objects in a humancomputer interface, international Journal of Man- Machine Studies, 31, 1989, 99-120.
Card, S. K., Moran, T. P., and Newell, A., The psychology of human computer interaction. Hillsdale, NJ:Erlbaum, 1983.
Kieras, D. E. and Polson, P. G., An approach to the formal analysis of user complexity, International Journal of Man-Machine Studies, 22, 1985, 365-394.
Tennant, N., The withering away of formal semantics, Mind and Language, 1, 1986, 302-318.

Barwise, J. and Etchemendy, J., Visual information and valid reasoning, in Visualization in Teaching and Learning Mathematics, S. Cunningham and W. Zimmerman (Eds.), Washington: Mathematical Association of America, in press, 1990.
Barwise, J. and Etchemendy, J., Information, infons, and inference, in Situation Theory and its Applications, I, R. Cooper, K. Mukai, and J. Perry (Eds.) Chicago:University of Chicago Press, 1990.
Gardin, F. and Meltzer, B., Analogical representations of naive physics, Artificial Intelligence, 38, 1989, 139-159.

Furnas, G. W., Formal models for imaginal deduction, Proceedings of the Twelfth Annual Conference of the Cognitive Science Society, (July 25-28, 1990, Cambridge, Mass.) Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum, 662-669.
Furnas, G. W., Working paper on theory, methods and examples of imaginal deduction, Bellcore Technical Memorandum, 1991.
Siromoney, G., Siromoney, R. and Krithivasan, K., Picture languages with array rewriting rules, Information and Control, 22, 1973, 447-470.
Rosenfeld, A., Array and web grammars: an overview. In A. Lindenmayer and G. Rozenberg (Eds.), Automata, Languages, Development, North-Holland, 1976, 517-529.
Post, E. L., Formal reductions of the general combinatorial decision problem, American Journal of Mathematics, 65, 1943,197-268.
Newell, A., and Simon, H., Human Problem Solving, Englewood Cliffs, NJ: Prentice-Hall, 1972.
Waterman, D. A. and Hayes-Roth, F., Pattern- Directed inference Systems, NewYork: Academic Press, 1978.

Furnas, G. W., "Graphical Reasoning for Graphical Interfaces" SIGGRAPH VIDEO #56. Shown in the Formal Video track of CHI'90, Seattle Washington, April 1990. Also shown in the INTERACT'90 video program, Cambridge England, August 1990.
Schneiderman, B., The future of interactive systems and the emergence of direct manipulation. Behavior and Information Technology, 1, 1982, 237-256.

Hutchins, E., Hollan, J., and Norman, D. A., Direct manipulation interfaces, in D.A. Norman and S. Draper (Eds.), User Centered System Design: New Perspectives on Human-Computer Interaction, Hillsdale, NJ: Lawrence Erlbaum Associates, 1986.
